welcome_message: Welcome to your personal guide for exploring Guadeloupe's most captivating sites. Track your journey through this beautiful Caribbean paradise.
start_exploring: Start exploring Guadeloupe and mark your first site! ‚ú®

site_la-soufriere_description: Active volcano and highest peak in the Lesser Antilles at 1,467m. Challenging hike through tropical rainforest with stunning crater views and sulfur vents.
site_pointe-des-chateaux_description: Dramatic rocky peninsula where the Atlantic Ocean meets the Caribbean Sea. Features stunning coastal views, a cross monument, and pristine beaches.
site_carbet-falls_description: Three spectacular waterfalls cascading through lush rainforest in the Basse-Terre National Park. The second fall (110m) is the most accessible.
site_memorial-acte_description: World-class museum dedicated to the history and memory of slavery and the slave trade. Housed in a striking modern building in Pointe-√†-Pitre.
site_grande-anse-beach_description: Long golden sand beach on Basse-Terre with calm waters, palm trees, and local food vendors. Perfect for swimming and relaxation.
site_cousteau-reserve_description: Protected marine park around Pigeon Island with coral reefs, sea turtles, and tropical fish. Premier snorkeling and diving destination.
site_les-saintes_description: Charming island group with Fort Napoleon, Pain de Sucre beach, and colorful villages. Day trip by ferry from Trois-Rivi√®res.
site_pointe-noire_description: Picturesque coastal village known for wood crafts, vanilla plantations, and beautiful black sand beaches. Gateway to the rainforest.
site_distillery-damoiseau_description: Working rum distillery offering tours and tastings. Learn about traditional rhum agricole production on Grande-Terre.
site_la-desirade_description: Remote, peaceful island with unspoiled beaches, hiking trails, and traditional Creole culture. Accessible by ferry from Saint-Fran√ßois.
site_jardin-botanique_description: Stunning 7-hectare tropical garden with exotic plants, waterfalls, and colorful birds. Former property of French singer Coluche.
site_port-louis_description: Beautiful beach with golden sand and turquoise waters on Grande-Terre's north coast. Popular for swimming and local cuisine.
